slides.script: I forgot my best friend's birthday...for the 3rd year in a row. The stress was making my mind so foggy, I could barely remember what I had for breakfast.
slides.image_prompt: Ultra photorealistic closeup of a stressed woman holding her head, looking disappointed, 16k, natural lighting, HDR, high resolution, shot on Canon EOS R5, Canon RF 50mm f/1.2L USM, depth of field, --s 750, 9:16 vertical format

slides.script: I was snapping at my kids, blanking on words mid-sentence, and walking into rooms having no idea why I was there. Stress brain fog was taking over my life.

slides.script: My sister, a naturopath, recommended I try ashwagandha. She explained it's been used for over 3000 years in Ayurvedic medicine to reduce stress and sharpen focus.

slides.script: I discovered ashwagandha is clinically proven to lower cortisol, the stress hormone. It's even been shown to regenerate brain cells and improve memory in medical studies.

slides.script: Day 3: I started feeling calmer. Day 7: Words came to me easier. Week 2: My husband said "You haven't forgotten anything in days!" After 1 month, it felt like a mental fog had lifted.
